title: Rewind to a Specific Commit
description: Git is a powerful version control system that allows developers to track changes made to their codebase. One of the most useful features of Git is the ability to rewind back to a specific commit. This can be helpful when you need to undo changes or revert to an earlier version of your code.

meta.title: Rewind to a Specific Commit in Git
meta.description: Learn how to undo changes and revert to an earlier version of your code using Git's powerful version control features.
meta.keywords: git, version control, commit, revert, undo

verify.name: Verify That Git Commit History Does Not Contain Added Files
verify.hint: Please make sure you have completed the required actions.
